intro: Melhania rotundata, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in warm, humid climates.
